artist: Artist: Peter Paone; Printer: Charles W. Hunsberger; Author: Ambrose Bierce
creditline: Gift of Joseph and Pamela Yohlin
description: winged creature with head of a bald baby flying in the sky at TC, clutching a cross in its talons; below in distance is a small similar creature clutching a bag; clouds in the sky with seascape below; peaked mountain at BR; part of a portfolio of eleven etchings
markings: BL to C below image, in graphite: 1/50 #3 Take not God\'s name in vain; select a time when it will have effect.; embossed seal BR corner: PRINTED / BY / C. W. HUNSBERGER
portfolio: From The Ten Commandments of Ambrose Bierce
signed: BR below image, in graphite: Paone
text: Peter Paone's print series imagines scenes inspired by poet Ambrose Bierce's "Decalogue" (1906). That poem was a satire on the Ten Commandments from the New Testament book of Exodus. For instance number 4 is: "work not on the sabbath days at all, But go to see the teams play ball." Number 9 is "Bear not false witness-that is low-But 'hear 'tis rumored so and so'." Paone was amused as much by Bierce's colorful life as his irreverent writing and he invented fantastic, even wittily demonic, images to accompany these new commandments.
title: #3 Take not God's name in vain; select a time when it will have effect.
